page.title: 16TRANSPORT - STRANRAER
page.content: Stranraer is situated in the south - west of Scotland and is served by two 'A' class roads, the{A75}and{A77. The A75 is also called{The Euroroute. It is so called because of the many heavy transport vehicles that carry goods along the road between the {English Channel Ferry Ports}and Stranraer, which is an important Ferry Port to Northern Ireland. The A77 leads to Ayr and Glasgow. Other forms of transport include the {Sealink ferries}and there is also a {train service}to Stranraer which still relies on diesel engines. Many locals own cars as it is often necessary to travel to larger towns such as Dumfries or Ayr to shop or find essential services, e.g. Garages dealing in specific makes of car. The nearest{commercial airport}to Stranraer is{Prestwick.
